MdToFb.title: Facebook Post Formatter
MdToFb.subtitle: Generate bold text, italic & special fonts for Facebook — preserves line breaks, one-click copy
MdToFb.hint: Bold works on English only (A-Z, 0-9). Chinese characters will remain unchanged.

steps.step1Desc: Type text or paste Markdown in the left editor panel. Supports bold, italic, strikethrough, headings, lists, and quotes.
steps.step2Desc: Click the Copy button and paste the formatted text into your Facebook post. Done!

faqs.q1: Can you use bold or special fonts in Facebook posts?
faqs.a1: Facebook doesn't support native rich-text formatting in regular posts. However, Unicode special characters can simulate bold, italic, strikethrough, and monospace effects. This tool automatically converts your text into these special fonts. It supports Markdown syntax and also accepts plain text.
faqs.q2: Why don't Chinese characters show bold, italic, or other effects?
faqs.a2: Unicode special fonts (bold, italic, strikethrough, monospace) only cover Latin letters (A-Z, a-z) and digits (0-9). Chinese, Japanese, and Korean characters have no Unicode styled variants, so they remain unchanged. This is a limitation of the Unicode standard, not the tool.
faqs.a3: This tool supports headings (#), bold (**text**), italic (*text*), strikethrough (~~text~~), inline code (`code`), unordered lists (- item), ordered lists (1. item), and horizontal rules (---). It also automatically preserves line breaks and spacing. You can optionally enable automatic spacing between Chinese and English text.
faqs.q4: Can I format AI-generated text for Facebook?
faqs.a4: Yes. Text from AI tools like ChatGPT and Claude is typically in Markdown format (e.g. **bold**, - lists). Simply paste it into this tool to automatically convert it into Facebook-ready formatting — no need to manually remove asterisks or other markup.
faqs.q5: How do I change the font in FB posts?
faqs.a5: Facebook doesn’t support custom fonts natively, but Unicode special characters can simulate bold, italic, and other effects. Use this tool or pair it with the Special Font Generator to convert text into multiple FB font styles.
faqs.q6: Why do line breaks disappear in Facebook posts?
faqs.a6: Facebook automatically strips extra blank lines. This tool inserts zero-width space characters to preserve your paragraph spacing and line breaks in FB posts — no manual workaround needed.
faqs.q7: Does this tool work for Instagram formatting?
faqs.a7: Yes. The bold, italic, and special fonts generated by this tool display correctly in Instagram posts, stories, and bios. Line breaks and paragraph spacing are also preserved when pasting to Instagram.
faqs.q8: How do I make bold text on Facebook?
faqs.a8: Facebook doesn’t support native bold formatting in regular posts. However, you can use Unicode bold characters to create visually bold text. This Facebook bold text generator automatically converts **bold** Markdown syntax into Unicode bold characters that display correctly in Facebook posts, comments, and bios.
faqs.q9: What text formatting options work on Facebook?
faqs.a9: Standard Facebook posts don’t support rich text formatting natively. This Facebook text formatting tool lets you simulate bold, italic, strikethrough, and monospace styles using Unicode special characters. It also preserves line breaks and paragraph spacing that Facebook normally removes. Paste Markdown or AI-generated text and get clean, formatted output.

Audit.externalLinks: External links reduce Facebook post reach. Consider placing links in the comments.

FontGenerator.title: Aesthetic Font Generator
FontGenerator.subtitle: Bold, script, fraktur, fancy text — 15 aesthetic styles, one-click copy to IG, FB, LINE
FontGenerator.hint: English letters and digits will be converted. Chinese stays unchanged.
FontGenerator.hintMixed: Chinese characters cannot be converted to special fonts (Unicode limitation). English letters and digits will convert normally.
FontGenerator.hintAllCjk: Your input is all Chinese. Add English letters or digits to see the conversion.
FontGenerator.tip: Best used sparingly — full fancy text is hard to read on mobile.
FontGenerator.whatIsContent: Special fonts use Unicode Mathematical Alphanumeric Symbols to transform regular English letters and digits into aesthetic styled text like bold (𝗕𝗼𝗹𝗮), script (𝓢𝓬𝓠𝓲𝗻𝘁), and double-struck (𝕆𝘂𝘁𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗮). This aesthetic font generator lets you copy and paste directly to Instagram, Facebook, LINE, and other social platforms — no font installation or app required.
FontGenerator.platformsTitle: Where Can You Use Special Fonts?
FontGenerator.platformsSummary: Posts, stories, bios, messages, nicknames — works on any platform that supports Unicode.
FontGenerator.vsFontDesc: Transform letters into different visual styles. Still searchable and copyable as text.
FontGenerator.vsSymbolDesc: Standalone graphic characters for decoration. Cannot be converted from text.
FontGenerator.vsSummary: Both work on social platforms. Combine them for the best effect.
FontGenerator.howToUseTitle: How to Use the Special Font Generator?

steps.step1Desc: Type the text you want to convert in the input field above. Supports mixed English, numbers, and Chinese.
steps.step2Desc: Click the Copy button next to your favorite font style, then paste it into IG, FB, LINE, or any social platform.

faqs.q1: Where can I use special fonts?
faqs.a1: You can use them on Facebook posts, Instagram bio and stories, Twitter/X, LINE messages, Discord, and all platforms that support Unicode.
faqs.a2: Special fonts use Unicode Mathematical Alphanumeric Symbols, which only cover English letters (A-Z) and digits (0-9). Chinese characters remain unchanged. Works best when combined with English.
faqs.q3: Can I use bold text in Facebook posts?
faqs.a3: Facebook doesn’t support native bold formatting, but you can use Unicode special fonts to achieve a visual bold effect. This tool offers bold, bold italic, and more.
faqs.q4: Do special fonts display on mobile?
faqs.a4: Most special fonts display correctly on iOS and Android. Some rare fonts may appear as boxes on certain devices. Test before posting.
faqs.q5: Do special fonts affect SEO or search rankings?
faqs.a5: Unicode special fonts cannot be properly indexed by search engines. They should only be used for social media decoration, not website body text.
faqs.q6: How do I change fonts on Instagram Stories?
faqs.a6: Type your text in this tool, pick a style (like Script or Fraktur), click Copy, then paste directly into your Instagram Story text box. No app install needed.
faqs.q7: How do I get fancy English fonts?
faqs.a7: Use the Script or Bold Script style in this tool to convert English text into elegant, fancy fonts. Perfect for Instagram bios or story text.
faqs.a8: Circled (Ⓒⓘⓡⓒⓛⓔⓓ) and Parenthesized (⒔⒞⒣ⓔ) are the most popular cute styles. Type your text, copy, and paste into your social posts.
faqs.q9: What special English font styles are available?
faqs.a9: This tool offers 15 styles: Bold, Italic, Bold Italic, Bold Script, Script, Fraktur, Double-Struck, Circled, Squared, Parenthesized, Upside Down, Strikethrough, Underline, Fullwidth, and Small Caps. All with instant preview and one-click copy.

ImageCompress.title: Online Image Compressor
ImageCompress.subtitle: Free JPG, PNG, WebP compression — reduce file size while keeping quality
ImageCompress.uploadLabel: Click or drag & drop to upload
ImageCompress.uploadHint: Supports JPG, PNG, WebP up to 10MB
ImageCompress.warmingUp: Server is warming up, please wait...
ImageCompress.unknownError: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.

steps.step1Desc: Click the upload area or drag & drop your image. Supports JPG, PNG, and WebP up to 10MB.
steps.step2Desc: Select Small File, Balanced, or High Quality mode based on your needs.
steps.step3Desc: Review the file size reduction and download your compressed image with one click.

faqs.a1: In High Quality mode, the quality loss is virtually invisible. Balanced mode offers the best trade-off between file size and quality for most use cases.
faqs.a2: We currently support JPEG (JPG), PNG, and WebP. The compressed image maintains the same format as the original.
faqs.q3: Where can I use compressed images?
faqs.a3: Compressed images are perfect for website uploads, social media posts, email attachments, and blog articles. Smaller files mean faster page loading.
faqs.q4: What is the maximum upload size?
faqs.a4: Each image can be up to 10MB. If your image exceeds this limit, consider reducing the resolution first.
faqs.q5: Are uploaded images stored on your server?
faqs.a5: No. All images are deleted immediately after processing. We do not store any of your uploaded images.
